com.linecorp.armeria.server

Interface PathMapping

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPathMapping

    public interface PathMapping
    Matches the absolute path part of a URI and translates the matched path to another path string. The translated path, returned by apply(String), determines the value of ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String apply(java.lang.String path)
      Matches the specified path and translates the matched path to another path string.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> exactPath()
      Returns the exact path of this path mapping if it is an exact path mapping, or Optional.empty() otherwise.
      java.lang.String loggerName()
      Returns the logger name.
      java.lang.String metricName()
      Returns the metric name.
      static PathMapping ofCatchAll()
      Returns a singleton PathMapping that always matches any path.
      static PathMapping ofExact(java.lang.String exactPath)
      Creates a new PathMapping that performs an exact match.
      static PathMapping ofGlob(java.lang.String glob)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified glob expression, where "*" matches a path component non-recursively and "**" matches path components recursively.
      static PathMapping ofPrefix(java.lang.String pathPrefix)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix.
      static PathMapping ofPrefix(java.lang.String pathPrefix, boolean stripPrefix)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix.
      static PathMapping ofRegex(java.util.regex.Pattern regex)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression, as defined in Pattern.
      static PathMapping ofRegex(java.lang.String regex)
      Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression, as defined in Pattern.
      default PathMapping prepend(java.lang.String pathPrefix)
      Creates a new PathMapping that prepends the specified pathPrefix to the matched path.
      default PathMapping stripParents()
      Creates a new PathMapping that removes all parent components from the matched path so that the ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() contains only a single path component.
      default PathMapping stripPrefix(int numPathComponents)
      Creates a new PathMapping that removes the first <numPathComponents> path components from the matched path so that the ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() does not have unnecessary path prefixes.
      default PathMapping stripPrefix(java.lang.String pathPrefix)
      Creates a new PathMapping that removes the specified pathPrefix from the matched path so that the ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() does not have the specified pathPrefix.

    • Method Detail

      • ofRegex

        static PathMapping ofRegex(java.util.regex.Pattern regex)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression, as defined in Pattern. The returned PathMapping does not perform any translation. To create a PathMapping that performs a translation, use the decorator methods like stripPrefix(String).

      • ofRegex

        static PathMapping ofRegex(java.lang.String regex)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified regular expression, as defined in Pattern. The returned PathMapping does not perform any translation. To create a PathMapping that performs a translation, use the decorator methods like stripPrefix(String).

      • ofGlob

        static PathMapping ofGlob(java.lang.String glob)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path with the specified glob expression, where "*" matches a path component non-recursively and "**" matches path components recursively. The returned PathMapping does not perform any translation. To create a PathMapping that performs a translation, use the decorator methods like stripPrefix(String).

      • ofPrefix

        static PathMapping ofPrefix(java.lang.String pathPrefix)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix. It also removes the specified directory prefix from the matched path so that ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() does not have the specified directory prefix. For example, when pathPrefix is "/foo/":
        • "/foo/" translates to "/"
        • "/foo/bar" translates to "/bar"
        • "/foo/bar/baz" translates to "/bar/baz"
        This method is a shortcut to ofPrefix(pathPrefix, true).

      • ofPrefix

        static PathMapping ofPrefix(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
                            boolean stripPrefix)
        Creates a new PathMapping that matches a path under the specified directory prefix. When stripPrefix is true, it also removes the specified directory prefix from the matched path so that ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() does not have the specified directory prefix. For example, when pathPrefix is "/foo/":
        • "/foo/" translates to "/"
        • "/foo/bar" translates to "/bar"
        • "/foo/bar/baz" translates to "/bar/baz"

      • ofExact

        static PathMapping ofExact(java.lang.String exactPath)
        Creates a new PathMapping that performs an exact match. The returned PathMapping always translates the matched path to "/".

      • ofCatchAll

        static PathMapping ofCatchAll()
        Returns a singleton PathMapping that always matches any path. The returned PathMapping does not perform any translation. To create a PathMapping that performs a translation, use the decorator methods like stripPrefix(String).

      • apply

        java.lang.String apply(java.lang.String path)
        Matches the specified path and translates the matched path to another path string.
        Parameters:
        path - an absolute path as defined in RFC3986
        Returns:
        the translated path which is used as the value of ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath(). null if the specified path does not match this mapping.

      • loggerName

        java.lang.String loggerName()
        Returns the logger name.
        Returns:
        the logger name

      • metricName

        java.lang.String metricName()
        Returns the metric name.
        Returns:
        the metric name whose components are separated by a dot (.)

      • exactPath

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> exactPath()
        Returns the exact path of this path mapping if it is an exact path mapping, or Optional.empty() otherwise. This can be useful for services which provide logic after scanning the server's mapped services, e.g. DocService

      • stripPrefix

        default PathMapping stripPrefix(java.lang.String pathPrefix)
        Creates a new PathMapping that removes the specified pathPrefix from the matched path so that the ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() does not have the specified pathPrefix. This method is useful when used with ofRegex(Pattern) or ofGlob(String). For example: 
        
 PathMapping.ofRegex("^/foo/[^/]+/bar/.*$").stripPrefix("/foo/");
 PathMapping.ofGlob("^/foo/&#42;/bar/&#42;&#42;").stripPrefix("/foo/");

      • stripPrefix

        default PathMapping stripPrefix(int numPathComponents)
        Creates a new PathMapping that removes the first <numPathComponents> path components from the matched path so that the ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() does not have unnecessary path prefixes. This method is useful when used with ofRegex(Pattern) or ofGlob(String). For example: 
        
 PathMapping.ofRegex("^/(foo|bar)/[^/]+/baz/.*$").stripPrefix(1);
 PathMapping.ofGlob("^/foo/&#42;/baz/&#42;&#42;").stripPrefix(1);

      • stripParents

        default PathMapping stripParents()
        Creates a new PathMapping that removes all parent components from the matched path so that the ServiceRequestContext.mappedPath() contains only a single path component. This method is useful when you are interested only in the file name part of the path.

      • prepend

        default PathMapping prepend(java.lang.String pathPrefix)
        Creates a new PathMapping that prepends the specified pathPrefix to the matched path.
